title: Augusta County: William L. Coan to Samuel Hunt, November 6, 1865
summary: In a postscript to an earlier letter, Coan informs Hunt that additional teachers are needed in the Valley. He also comments on F. S. Tukey's frustrations with AMA administrators. He notes that he will return to the Valley after visiting Richmond and Norfolk, unless otherwise directed.
keywords: African Americans, Education, American Civil War
